DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not therapy for cytomegalovirus viremia was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of cytomegalovirus viremia, an intracellular herpesvirus characterized by narrow host specificity and slow reproduction in the blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: widely occurring intracellular herpesvirus characterized by narrow host specificity and slow reproduction (latency); causes a variety of pathologies in mammals, including AIDS related oculopathy in humans.:the presence of viruses in the blood.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A genus of the family herpesviridae, subfamily betaherpesvirinae, infecting the salivary glands, liver, spleen, lungs, eyes, and other organs, in which they produce characteristically enlarged cells with intranuclear inclusions.
A laboratory test result indicating the presence of a virus in the blood.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
